content.webTitle: Rugby World Cup team guide: Romania

fields.headline: Romania
fields.bodyText: Pedigree and form The Oaks have won a game in every event except 1995 and took bronze at the 1924 Olympics, though there were only three teams competing. In 1981, with a team centred on Nicolai Ceaucescu's ever-so-popular army and police, they nearly beat the All Blacks. Qualified ahead of Georgia and Spain and beat Namibia in June. How they see it Record 134-0 defeat, by England in 2001, could come under threat against New Zealand, but they'll fancy their chances against Portugal, a team they pipped 92-0 in 1996. Also won their most recent meeting with Italy, in 2004. The coach Daniel Santamans' reign began inauspiciously but the French pack specialist has instilled much-needed discipline since then, working on a shoestring. The captain Sorin Socol has led the side since 2003. The 29-year-old Pau lock, one of a number of highly rated and French-based forwards, has relatively fast feet for a very big man indeed. The linchpin Romeo Gontineac attends his fourth World Cup. The centre, who plays for Aurillac in France, has scored 17 tries for his country. How they'll play With extremely big forwards and not much else. Following one tradition that the collapse of the country's Communist dictatorship did not sweep away, this side has an average pack weight of around 18 stone, thanks to the likes of monster prop Petru Balan. That's up there with the biggest teams. Key fact Florica Murariu, the team's captain in the heady days of the 1980s, was shot dead at a roadblock during the 1989 revolution. Omen A double celebration is in store for Razvan Mavrodin on September 29 - his 34th birthday and victory over the All Blacks. World Cup odds 2,000-1 The squad Forwards Bogdan Balan age 27, 16 caps Petru Balan 31, 51 Florin Corodeanu 30, 47 Silviu Florea 30, 17 Alexandru Manta 30, 24 Razvan Mavrodin 33, 42 Cristian Petre 28, 52 Augustin Petrichei 27, 12 Cezar Popescu 30, 29 Cosmin Ratiu 28, 17 Sorin Socol capt, 29, 39 Marius Tincu 29, 28 Petrisor Toderasc 27, 43 Ovidiu Tonita 27, 38 Alexandru Tudori 29, 38 Valentin Ursache 22, 15 Backs Gabriel Brezoianu 30, 65 Valentin Calafeteanu 22, 11 Ionut Dimofte 22, 16 Danut Dumbrava 26, 31 Iulian Dumitras 25, 10 Catalin Fercu 21, 14 Csaba Gal 22, 8 Romeo Gontineac 34, 71 Catalin Nicolae 27, 2 Lucian Sirbu 30, 51 Ioan Teodorescu 31, 38 Ionut Tofan 30, 55 Dan Vlad 24, 6 Florian Vlaicu 21, 9
